key_finding_1: At least 16 states enacted 29 restrictive voting laws in 2025, with 28 taking effect before the 2026 midterms; since 2020, at least 30 states have enacted 108 restrictive laws (Brennan Center, Oct 2025)
key_finding_2: Seven states passed stricter voter ID laws requiring birth certificates or passports; 27 states considered proof-of-citizenship requirements (Voting Rights Lab, 2025)
key_finding_3: DOJ requested voter registration files from most states searching for ineligible voters; SAVE Act requiring documentary proof of citizenship stalled in Senate but pursued via executive order (Brennan Center)

key_finding_1: Deputy AG Todd Blanche declared administration at 'war' with federal judiciary at Federalist Society conference (Nov 2025); NYC Bar Association condemned remarks as assault on judicial independence
key_finding_2: More than 100 DOJ prosecutors and career lawyers resigned since Jan 2025—far exceeding normal turnover—citing political interference and pressure to drop cases involving Trump allies (Al Jazeera)
key_finding_3: DOJ fired top career ethics official and purged officials involved in Trump-related investigations; AG Bondi ordered prosecutors to drop charges against NYC Mayor Eric Adams, prompting resignations

key_finding_1: DNI Gabbard fired top two National Intelligence Council officials after they refused to revise Venezuela gang assessment to support administration deportation narrative (Just Security)
key_finding_2: Sen. Warner warned of 'systematic undermining' of intelligence community independence through firings, revoked clearances, and retaliatory reassignments silencing decades of expertise (Sept 2025)
key_finding_3: CIA offered buyouts to entire workforce (Feb 2025); intelligence resources diverted to support Greenland annexation proposal rather than monitoring adversaries like China, Iran, Russia (Foreign Affairs)

key_finding_1: President signed 229 executive orders, 57 memoranda, and 118 proclamations in first year—dramatically increasing tempo and detail of directives compared to prior administrations (Ballotpedia)
key_finding_2: AI Executive Order (Dec 2025) established federal framework and litigation task force to challenge state AI laws; reversed Biden-era AI safeguards (Sidley Austin)
key_finding_3: Supreme Court hearing Trump v. Slaughter on authority to fire independent agency heads—outcome affects SEC, FTC, FERC regulated businesses (Holland & Knight)

key_finding_1: 'Liberation Day' tariffs (April 2, 2025) imposed 10% baseline tariff on nearly all imports plus country-specific tariffs up to 49%; CSIS modeling projects 1% GDP reduction (~$300B annual loss) and 9.5% price increases (CSIS)
key_finding_2: US-China retaliatory spiral raised US tariffs on Chinese goods to 145% and Chinese tariffs on US goods to 125%; trade deficit through May 2025 was $175B larger than prior year (CFR)
key_finding_3: Court of International Trade ruled tariffs exceeded presidential authority (May 2025); appeals court allowed tariffs to remain pending Supreme Court review; 73% of Americans expect price surge (Reuters/Ipsos)

key_finding_1: Public Citizen found 16 of 24 White House ballroom project donors have government contracts; these companies received over $279B in federal contracts over past five years (Public Citizen/Common Dreams)
key_finding_2: Over half of ballroom donor companies face federal enforcement actions including labor rights cases, SEC enforcement, and antitrust actions; Lockheed among 14 facing NLRB unfair labor practice cases (Washington Post)
key_finding_3: DOGE-led consolidation terminated or economized 6,000+ contracts; Executive Order mandates GSA consolidation of procurement with projected $50B annual savings claim (White House Fact Sheet)

key_finding_1: Trump attempted to fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook over unproven fraud claims—unprecedented action testing presidential power over central bank; case likely heading to Supreme Court (NBC News)
key_finding_2: DOJ probe of Federal Reserve marks escalation; Fed Chair Powell accused administration of using prosecutors to interfere with rate decisions; Powell vowed to 'stand firm in face of threats' (NPR)
key_finding_3: Administration appointed Stephen Miran to Fed board while he retained administration position; Miran cast sole dissent on rate cut wanting deeper reduction; economists warn interference threatens market stability (Center for American Progress)

key_finding_1: Committee to Protect Journalists reports press freedom 'no longer a given in the United States'; FCC Chair opened investigations into ABC, NBC, CBS, and local outlets (CPJ/ACLU)
key_finding_2: Harvard rejected administration demands on admissions/hiring; administration terminated $2.2B in grants (April 2025) and barred new grants (May 2025); Princeton president called cuts 'greatest threat since Red Scare' (CNN)
key_finding_3: Seven universities rejected 'Compact for Academic Excellence' requiring enrollment caps and DEI elimination; Cornell faces $1B+ funding pause, Northwestern nearly $800M (Inside Higher Ed)

key_finding_1: Threats against federal judges more than tripled over past decade; 2025 on pace to surpass previous highs according to U.S. Marshals Service data (NYC Bar Association)
key_finding_2: Pardons issued for ~1,500 January 6 defendants including Oath Keepers/Proud Boys leaders convicted of seditious conspiracy; DOJ official called it 'green light' to political violence (NPR)
key_finding_3: Historians warn pardons follow authoritarian playbook; pardoned defendants called for retribution against prosecutors and police who testified; counterterrorism researchers say move encourages future political violence (Stanford Law)

key_finding_1: 17 inspectors general fired via email on January 24, 2025 citing 'changing priorities'; federal judge ruled firings unlawful but declined reinstatement; Council of IGs stated action not 'legally sufficient' (Lawfare)
key_finding_2: Schedule F revival will strip civil service protections from estimated 50,000 federal employees; OPM rule creates 'Schedule Policy/Career' classification enabling rapid termination of career staff (Federal News Network)
key_finding_3: Intelligence Authorization Act for FY2026 mandates annual surveys on analytic objectivity and bias, reflecting Congressional concern over politicization of intelligence agencies (Senate Intelligence Committee)
